article.author: Colin Taylor
article.mainText: The protests that shook the city of Charlotte last night and injured sixteen police officers have continued into a second night. One person has been shot dead; it is still unclear whether or not the police or a civilian was the shooter. The public displays of frustration over the police shooting of Keith Lamont Scott have mostly been peaceful but certain agitators have been escalating the situation with rocks and looting. The police, in their imposing riot gear and hurling tear gas into the crowds, are not de-escalating matters. The protesters are demanding that the police release the video of the killing of Keith Lamont Scott; the state is responding the only way it knows how – with violence. We hope that protesters will remain peaceful and understand their frustration with the reckless enthusiasm with which American police officers seem to be killing African-American citizens. UPDATE: It appears the National Guard is on the way. Reporter @JoeBrunoWSOC9 says "help is coming from Washington" per #Charlotte mayor.#CharlotteProtest #CharlotteUprising #KeithScott — Andrew Westmoreland (@drewwest_press) September 22, 2016 Here is a livestream of the incident, courtesy of RT. Updates will continue to be posted as they occur. Protestors huddle in pkg garage after getting hit by tear gas. Pour milk in eyes & mouth. Say do not use water in eyes. #CharlotteProtest pic.twitter.com/INGqArCENK — Heather Lacy (@Heather_Lacy1) September 22, 2016 RT MashableNews: Police rush to grab, arrest protester at #CharlotteProtest pic.twitter.com/GSYMs2Srmh — TeeChip USA (@TeeChip_USA) September 22, 2016
article.title: BREAKING: One Person Killed As Protests, Teargas Rock Charlotte For A Second Night (UPDATES)
